content.description: This is the third largest boulder in Lewis Larus park, but it still isn't very big.  For this route, start on the left end of the side of the boulder facing the creek and traverse to the right. Use the high edge to traverse the first with your feet, reaching over the top of the boulder, then drop down and do the second face from underneath.  Finish the traverse using the obvious edge for feet and the edge of the top of the boulder for hands.
content.location: Park at the gate of Sabot at Stony Point school and walk into the park from there.  Follow the trail until you see the nice bridge going over the creek down to your right (about 5 minutes).  Head down the creek from there for a couple hundred feet.  Boulder is on the south side of the creek.

content.description: This is the third largest boulder in Lewis Larus park, but it still isn't very big.  This route is a traverse around the boulder where the goal is to keep your head below the highest point of the boulder during the whole traverse, topping it at the end. content.location: Park at the gate of Sabot at Stony Point school and walk into the park from there.  Follow the trail until you see the nice bridge going over the creek down to your right (about 5 minutes).  Head down the creek from there for a couple hundred feet.  Boulder is on the south side of the creek.

content.description: Large park full of trees and some trails. No fees, easy access from Huguenot/Forest Hill. Only 3-4 parking spots in front of Sabot at Stony Point school, but they are rarely full
